response_parsed.title: Designing CLI Tools Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a comprehensive guide on how to create Command Line Interface (CLI) tools utilizing FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs, in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Creating a new FastAPI project with CLI functionality
Defining routes and endpoints for CLI interactions
Handling command line arguments and flags
Using FastAPI's background tasks for asynchronous operations

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, CommandLine
app = FastAPI()
nl = CommandLine(app)
# Define routes...

async def my_cli_function():
   # Your asynchronous operation goes here...
@nl.command()
async def cli_cmd():
    await my_cli_function()

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for using FastAPI's CLI functionality
FastAPI version 0.74.0 or higher is recommended
caveats: FastAPI's CLI tools may not be as feature-rich or optimized for complex CLI applications as dedicated libraries like Click or Argparse
Be aware of potential differences in handling command line arguments and flags between FastAPI and traditional CLI libraries
